info.name: Familiars
info.description: Minimic from Heliana's Guide to Monster Hunting

description.p: Armor Class 12 (natural armour)
Hit Points 4 (1d4 + 2)
Speed 25 ft.
Skills Stealth +2
Damage Immunities acid
Condition Immunities prone
Senses darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 10
Languages —
Adhesive. The minimic adheres to anything that touches it. A creature no more than one size larger than the minimic that is adhered to the minimic is also grappled by it (escape DC 12).
False Appearance. While the minimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

Shapechanger. The minimic can use its action to polymorph into an object equal to it in size, or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

Pseudopod.
Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage. The target is subjected to the minimic’s Adhesive trait.

Bite.
Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) acid damage.

description.p: Whenever you gain a level beyond 1st in this class, each companion to which you are bonded gains one of the following improvements. Any newly gained companions receive these additional Hit Dice and improvements as if you had them since your 1st level in tamer.

sheet.description: The Minimic has the following Improvements:

description.p: Type: Passive (companion)

The minimic’s size increases to Small, its Hit Die size increases to a d6 (its hit point maximum consequently increases by 1 for each of its Hit Dice), and the damage dice of its Bite and Pseudopod attacks increase to a d6. The minimic gains this improvement when it becomes a companion; it doesn’t cost an improvement.

sheet.description: The minimic’s size increases to Small, its Hit Die size increases to a d6 (its hit point maximum consequently increases by 1 for each of its Hit Dice), and the damage dice of its Bite and Pseudopod attacks increase to a d6.

description.p: Type: Passive (companion)
The minimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

sheet.description: ADV on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

description.p: Type: Passive (companion)
Creatures grappled by the minimic have disadvantage on ability checks made to escape its grapple.

sheet.description: Creatures grappled by the minimic have DISADV to escape.

description.p: Type: Passive (companion)

The minimic’s size increases to Medium, its Hit Die size increases to a d8 (its hit point maximum consequently increases by 1 for each of its Hit Dice), and the damage dice of its Bite and Pseudopod attacks increase from a d6 to a d8.

sheet.description: The minimic’s size increases to Medium, its Hit Die size increases to a d8 (its hit point maximum consequently increases by 1 for each of its Hit Dice), and the damage dice of its Bite and Pseudopod attacks increase from a d6 to a d8.

description.p: Type: Active (action)
As an action, the minimic can make two attacks: one with its Pseudopod and one with its Bite.

sheet.description: Two attacks: one Pseudopod and one Bite.

description.p: Type: Active (action)

As an action, the minimic can regurgitate a torrent of acidic bile. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
After the minimic uses this action, it can’t do so again until its tamer finishes a short or long rest.
When the minimic’s tamer reaches 9th level in the tamer class, the damage of this action increases to 24 (7d6).

sheet.description: {{regurgitate:cone}}-foot cone DC {{regurgitate:dc}} DEX Save, taking {{regurgitate:damage}} acid or half

description.p: Type: Passive (companion)
The minimic gains a +2 bonus to its AC while it isn’t wearing armour.

sheet.description: The minimic gains a +2 bonus to its AC while it isn’t wearing armour.

description.p: Type: Active (bonus action)

As a bonus action, the minimic can secrete acid. Each creature grappling or grappled by the minimic takes acid damage equal to the minimic’s current Hit Die size (1d4, or higher, if it has further Growth improvements).

sheet.description: Grappling or grappled creatures takes 1d{{hit dice size:minimic}}acid

description.p: Type: Active (action)
The damage of the minimic’s Regurgitate action increases to 31 (9d6), and the size of the cone increases to 25 feet. The minmic gains a +1 bonus to the save DC of this action.
When the minimic’s tamer reaches 17th level in the tamer class, the damage of this action increases to 42 (12d6).

The minimic’s size increases to Large, its Hit Die size increases to a d10 (its hit point maximum consequently increases by 1 for each of its Hit Dice), and the damage dice of its Bite and Pseudopod attacks increase from a d8 to a d10.

description.p: Increase one existing speed by 15 feet up to a maximum of 150% of the creature’s base speed, rounded up to the nearest 5-foot increment.
E.g., a base speed of 30 feet can be increased to 45 feet maximum, a base speed of 25 feet can be increased to 40 feet, and a base speed of 20 feet to 30 feet.

sheet.description: Increase one existing speed by 15 feet (Max of 150%)

p.i: Your companion can’t gain proficiency in medium and heavy armour until it has gained proficiency in the prerequisite lighter armour types. For example, to gain proficiency in heavy armour, you must take this improvement 3 times: light, then medium, then heavy. Work with your GM to figure out if and how a creature can wield shields and weapons.
